reasoning: AML with t(8;21) translocation (RUNX1-RUNX1T1) is a cytogenetically defined subtype of acute myeloblastic leukemia, representing ~10-15% of AML cases. Global AML incidence ~3 per 100k; t(8;21) represents significant fraction, estimated 0.7-0.9 per 100k. Favorable prognosis subtype.
source: Grimwade D et al. (2010). Refinement of cytogenetic classification in acute myeloid leukemia: Determination of prognostic significance of rare recurring chromosomal abnormalities among 5,876 younger adult patients. Blood. 116(3):354-365
